page.title: 10Kimbolton - History
page.content: Limited archaeological finds in the vicinity of the old airfield suggest that there may have been a small{Roman settlement there,but Kimbolton's name is{Anglo-Saxon}meaning "Cenebald's estate".The physical setting will have dictated the site of the present village - the protection of the small surrounding hills;the route-crossing; the river-crossing;the gravel terraces overlaying the clay,encouraging building.By{Domesday}the population had reached about 500,second only in Huntingdonshire to the county town itself.The{Lords of the Manor}are responsible for the steady development during the medieval period - the enlargement of the church,the relocation of the castle and the layout of the market-town.
